trans-unit.source: NOTE: It is generally an error to make this equivalent to STORESIZE. Perl may from time to time call EXTEND without wanting to actually change the array size directly. Any tied array should function correctly if this method is a no-op, even if perhaps they might not be as efficient as they would if this method was implemented.
trans-unit.target: 注意：将其等效于STORESIZE通常是错误的。Perl可能会不时调用EXTEND，而又不想直接更改数组大小。如果此方法为空操作，则任何绑定的数组都应正确运行，即使它们可能不如实施此方法时那样有效。

trans-unit.source: NOTE: users of FATAL warnings, especially those using FATAL => 'all' , should be fully aware that they are risking future portability of their programs by doing so. Perl makes absolutely no commitments to not introduce new warnings or warnings categories in the future; indeed, we explicitly reserve the right to do so. Code that may not warn now may warn in a future release of Perl if the Perl5 development team deems it in the best interests of the community to do so. Should code using FATAL warnings break due to the introduction of a new warning we will NOT consider it an incompatible change. Users of FATAL warnings should take special caution during upgrades to check to see if their code triggers any new warnings and should pay particular attention to the fine print of the documentation of the features they use to ensure they do not exploit features that are documented as risky, deprecated, or unspecified, or where the documentation says "so don't do that", or anything with the same sense and spirit. Use of such features in combination with FATAL warnings is ENTIRELY AT THE USER'S RISK.
trans-unit.target: 注意： FATAL警告的用户，尤其是使用 FATAL => 'all' ，应充分意识到这样做会冒着将来程序移植的风险。 Perl绝对不承诺将来不引入新的警告或警告类别。实际上，我们明确保留这样做的权利。如果Perl5开发团队认为这样做可能符合社区的最大利益，那么现在可能不会发出警告的代码可能会在Perl的将来版本中发出警告。如果由于引入了新警告而使使用致命警告的代码中断，我们将不认为这是不兼容的更改。 FATAL警告的用户在升级过程中应格外小心，以检查其代码是否触发了任何新警告，并应特别注意其使用的功能文档的精细印刷，以确保他们不会利用被记录为有风险的功能，已弃用或未指定，或文档说“不要这样做”的地方，或者具有相同意识和精神的任何东西。结合使用此类功能和致命警告完全由用户承担风险。

trans-unit.source: NOTE: At the time of writing, the following pair* functions that take a block do not modify the value of $_ within the block, and instead operate using the $a and $b globals instead. This has turned out to be a poor design, as it precludes the ability to provide a pairsort function. Better would be to pass pair-like objects as 2-element array references in $_, in a style similar to the return value of the pairs function. At some future version this behaviour may be added.
trans-unit.target: 注意：在编写本文时，以下带块的 pair* 函数不会修改块中 $_ 的值，而是使用 $a 和 $b 全局变量来操作。事实证明这是一个糟糕的设计，因为它无法提供 pairsort 功能。更好的方法是将类似于对的对象作为 $_ 中的2元素数组引用传递，其样式类似于 pairs 函数的返回值。在将来的版本中，可能会添加此行为。

trans-unit.source: NOTE: In Perl 5.6.0 it used to be that one needed to say use utf8 to use any Unicode features. This is no more the case: for almost all Unicode processing, the explicit utf8 pragma is not needed. (The only case where it matters is if your Perl script is in Unicode and encoded in UTF-8, then an explicit use utf8 is needed.)
trans-unit.target: 注意：在Perl 5.6.0中，过去常常需要说 use utf8 来使用任何Unicode功能。情况不再如此：对于几乎所有的Unicode处理，都不需要显式的 utf8 编译指示。（唯一重要的情况是，如果您的Perl脚本是Unicode并以UTF-8编码的，则需要显式 use utf8 。）

trans-unit.target: 注意：损坏的或恶意的 LC_CTYPE 语言环境定义可能会导致您的应用程序将明显不合格的字符视为字母数字字符。为了严格匹配（普通）ASCII字母和数字（例如，在命令字符串中），支持区域设置的应用程序应将 \w 与 /a 正则表达式修饰符配合使用。请参阅“安全性”。

trans-unit.source: Note: A broken or malicious LC_CTYPE locale definition may result in clearly ineligible characters being considered to be alphanumeric by your application. For strict matching of (mundane) ASCII letters and digits--for example, in command strings--locale-aware applications should use \w with the /a regular expression modifier. See SECURITY.
trans-unit.target: 注意：损坏的或恶意的 LC_CTYPE 语言环境定义可能会导致应用程序将明显不合格的字符视为字母数字字符。为了严格匹配（普通）ASCII字母和数字（例如，在命令字符串中），支持区域设置的应用程序应将 \w 与 /a 正则表达式修饰符配合使用。请参阅“ 安全性”。

trans-unit.source: Note: According to the Unicode standard, the canonical decomposition of the character that is not canonically decomposable is same as the character itself.
trans-unit.target: 注意：根据Unicode标准，不可规范分解的字符的规范分解与字符本身相同。

trans-unit.source: Note: According to the Unicode standard, the compatibility decomposition of the character that is not compatibility decomposable is same as the character itself.
trans-unit.target: 注意：根据Unicode标准，不可兼容分解的字符的兼容性分解与字符本身相同。

trans-unit.source: Note: If a context is acquired more than once an internal refcount is kept. release() decrements the ref count, none of the other actions of release() will occur unless the refcount hits 0. This means only the last call to release() will reset $?, $!, $@,and run the cleanup tasks.
trans-unit.target: 注意：如果多次获取上下文，则保留内部引用计数。 release() 减少引用计数，除非refcount达到0，否则 release() 的其他任何操作都不会发生。这意味着只有对 release() 的最后一次调用才能重置 $? ， $! ， $@ 并运行清理任务。

trans-unit.source: Note: In Perl v5.30 and newer, if the socket has been marked as :utf8, recv will throw an exception. The :encoding(...) layer implicitly introduces the :utf8 layer. See "binmode" in perlfunc.
trans-unit.target: 注意：在Perl v5.30及更高版本中，如果套接字已标记为 :utf8 ，则 recv 将引发异常。的 :encoding(...) 层隐含介绍 :utf8 层。请参阅perlfunc中的“ binmode”。

trans-unit.source: Note: In Perl v5.30 and newer, if the socket has been marked as :utf8, send will throw an exception. The :encoding(...) layer implicitly introduces the :utf8 layer. See "binmode" in perlfunc.
trans-unit.target: 注意：在Perl v5.30及更高版本中，如果套接字已标记为 :utf8 ，则 send 将引发异常。的 :encoding(...) 层隐含介绍 :utf8 层。请参阅perlfunc中的“ binmode”。

trans-unit.source: Note: In Perl versions older than v5.30, depending on the status of the socket, either (8-bit) bytes or characters are received. By default all sockets operate on bytes, but for example if the socket has been changed using "binmode" in perlfunc to operate with the :encoding(UTF-8) I/O layer (see the "open" in perlfunc pragma), the I/O will operate on UTF8-encoded Unicode characters, not bytes. Similarly for the :encoding layer: in that case pretty much any characters can be read.
trans-unit.target: 注意：在低于v5.30的Perl版本中，根据套接字的状态，将接收（8位）字节或字符。默认情况下，所有套接字都以字节为单位，但是例如，如果套接字已在perlfunc中使用“ binmode”进行了更改，以与 :encoding(UTF-8) I / O层一起运行（请参见perlfunc pragma中的“ open”），则I / O将对UTF8编码的Unicode字符（而不是字节）进行操作。对于 :encoding 层来说类似：在这种情况下，几乎所有字符都可以读取。

trans-unit.source: Note: In Perl versions older than v5.30, depending on the status of the socket, either (8-bit) bytes or characters are sent. By default all sockets operate on bytes, but for example if the socket has been changed using "binmode" in perlfunc to operate with the :encoding(UTF-8) I/O layer (see the "open" in perlfunc pragma), the I/O will operate on UTF8-encoded Unicode characters, not bytes. Similarly for the :encoding layer: in that case pretty much any characters can be sent.
trans-unit.target: 注意：在低于v5.30的Perl版本中，根据套接字的状态，将发送（8位）字节或字符。默认情况下，所有套接字都以字节为单位，但是例如，如果套接字已在perlfunc中使用“ binmode”进行了更改，以与 :encoding(UTF-8) I / O层一起运行（请参见perlfunc pragma中的“ open”），则I / O将对UTF8编码的Unicode字符（而不是字节）进行操作。对于 :encoding 层类似：在这种情况下，几乎可以发送任何字符。

trans-unit.source: Note: In addition to them, 12 CJK compatibility ideographs (U+FA0E , U+FA0F , U+FA11 , U+FA13 , U+FA14 , U+FA1F , U+FA21 , U+FA23 , U+FA24 , U+FA27 , U+FA28 , U+FA29 ) are also treated as CJK unified ideographs. But they can't be overridden via overrideCJK when you use DUCET, as the table includes weights for them. table or entry has priority over overrideCJK .
trans-unit.target: 注意：除了它们之外，12个CJK兼容性表意文字（ U+FA0E ， U+FA0F ， U+FA11 ， U+FA13 ， U+FA14 ， U+FA1F ， U+FA21 ， U+FA23 ， U+FA24 ， U+FA27 ， U+FA28 ， U+FA29 ）也被视为CJK统一表意文字。但是当您使用DUCET时，不能通过 overrideCJK 覆盖它们，因为该表包含它们的权重。 table 或 entry 优先级高于 overrideCJK 。

But they can't be overridden via overrideCJK when you use DUCET, as the table includes weights for them. table or entry has priority over overrideCJK.

trans-unit.source: Note: In order to conform to naming conventions for Perl extensions and functions, the name of this package was changed to from VMS::stdio to VMS::Stdio as of Perl 5.002, and the names of some routines were changed. For many releases, calls to the old VMS::stdio routines would generate a warning, and then route to the equivalent VMS::Stdio function. This compatibility interface has now been removed.
trans-unit.target: 注意：为了符合Perl扩展和功能的命名约定，从Perl 5.002开始，此软件包的名称从VMS :: stdio更改为VMS :: Stdio，并且某些例程的名称也进行了更改。对于许多发行版，对旧的VMS :: stdio例程的调用将生成警告，然后路由至等效的VMS :: Stdio函数。现在已删除此兼容性接口。

trans-unit.source: Note: Test2::Util::HashBase checks for an init using $class->can('init') during construction. It DOES NOT call can() on the created object. Also note that the result of the check is cached, it is only ever checked once, the first time an instance of your class is created. This means that adding an init() method AFTER the first construction will result in it being ignored.
trans-unit.target: 注意： Test2 :: Util :: HashBase在构造过程中使用 $class->can('init') 检查初始化。它不会在创建的对象上调用 can() 。还要注意，检查的结果会被缓存，它只会在第一次创建类实例时被检查一次。这意味着在第一个构造之后添加 init() 方法将导致它被忽略。

trans-unit.source: Note: The context will actually be cloned, the clone will be used instead of the original. This allows the thread id, process id, and error variables to be correct without modifying the original context.

trans-unit.source: Note: The database file format has changed multiple times in Berkeley DB version 2, 3 and 4. If you cannot recreate your databases, you must dump any existing databases with either the db_dump or the db_dump185 utility that comes with Berkeley DB. Once you have rebuilt DB_File to use Berkeley DB version 2 or greater, your databases can be recreated using db_load . Refer to the Berkeley DB documentation for further details.
trans-unit.target: 注意：在Berkeley DB版本2、3和4中，数据库文件格式已多次更改。如果无法重新创建数据库，则必须使用Berkeley DB随附的 db_dump 或 db_dump185 实用程序转储所有现有数据库。一旦重建了DB_File以使用Berkeley DB版本2或更高版本，就可以使用 db_load 重新创建数据库。有关更多详细信息，请参考Berkeley DB文档。

trans-unit.source: Note:%- and %+ are tied views into a common internal hash associated with the last successful regular expression. Therefore mixing iterative access to them via each may have unpredictable results. Likewise, if the last successful match changes, then the results may be surprising.

trans-unit.source: Note that any information about the hash function, especially the hash seed is sensitive information: by knowing it, one can craft a denial-of-service attack against Perl code, even remotely; see "Algorithmic Complexity Attacks" in perlsec for more information. Do not disclose the hash seed to people who don't need to know it. See also hash_seed() and hash_traversal_mask().
trans-unit.target: 请注意，有关散列函数的任何信息，尤其是散列种子，都是敏感信息：通过了解，可以对Perl代码进行拒绝服务攻击，甚至可以远程进行。有关更多信息，请参见perlsec中的“算法复杂度攻击”。不要将哈希种子泄露给不需要知道的人。另请参见 hash_seed() 和 hash_traversal_mask() 。

In Perl you can backtrack into a recursed group, in PCRE and Python the recursed into group is treated as atomic. Also, modifiers are resolved at compile time, so constructs like (?i:(?1)) or (?:(?i)(?1)) do not affect how the sub-pattern will be processed.

trans-unit.source: Passive - If set to a non-zero value then all data transfers will be done using passive mode. If set to zero then data transfers will be done using active mode. If the machine is connected to the Internet directly, both passive and active mode should work equally well. Behind most firewall and NAT configurations passive mode has a better chance of working. However, in some rare firewall configurations, active mode actually works when passive mode doesn't. Some really old FTP servers might not implement passive transfers. If not specified, then the transfer mode is set by the environment variable FTP_PASSIVE or if that one is not set by the settings done by the
trans-unit.target: 被动 -如果设置为非零值，则所有数据传输都将使用被动模式进行。如果设置为零，则将使用活动模式进行数据传输。如果机器直接连接到Internet，则被动模式和主动模式都应同样工作。在大多数防火墙和NAT配置的背后，被动模式具有更好的工作机会。但是，在一些罕见的防火墙配置中，主动模式实际上在被动模式不起作用时起作用。一些非常老的FTP服务器可能未实现被动传输。如果未指定，则传输模式由环境变量 FTP_PASSIVE 设置，或者如果没有由环境变量FTP_PASSIVE进行设置，则设置为传输模式。

Perl has never guaranteed any ordering of the hash keys, and the ordering has already changed several times during the lifetime of Perl 5. Also, the ordering of hash keys has always been, and continues to be, affected by the insertion order and the history of changes made to the hash over its lifetime.

trans-unit.source: Pod::Parser is a base class for creating POD filters and translators. It handles most of the effort involved with parsing the POD sections from an input stream, leaving subclasses free to be concerned only with performing the actual translation of text.

trans-unit.source: Pod::Parser makes use of several internal methods and data fields which clients should not need to see or use. trans-unit.source: Polymorphism is a fancy way of saying that objects from two different classes share an API. For example, we could have File and WebPage classes which both have a print_content() method. This method might produce different output for each class, but they share a common interface.
trans-unit.target: 多态是一种说法，即来自两个不同类的对象共享一个API。例如，我们可以有 File 和 WebPage 类，它们都具有 print_content() 方法。对于每个类，此方法可能会产生不同的输出，但是它们共享一个公共接口。

trans-unit.source: Port - The port number to connect to on the remote machine for the FTP connection

trans-unit.source: Port - port to connect to. Default - 110 for plain POP3 and 995 for POP3s (direct SSL).
trans-unit.target: 端口 -要连接的端口。默认值-普通POP3为110，POP3（直接SSL）为995。

trans-unit.source: Port - port to connect to. Default - 119 for plain NNTP and 563 for immediate SSL (nntps).
trans-unit.target: 端口 -要连接的端口。默认-普通NNTP为119，即时SSL（nntps）为563。

trans-unit.source: Port - port to connect to. Default - 25 for plain SMTP and 465 for immediate SSL.
trans-unit.target: 端口 -要连接的端口。默认-对于纯SMTP为25，对于即时SSL为465。

trans-unit.source: Reader - If the remote server is INN then initially the connection will be to innd, by default Net::NNTP will issue a MODE READER command so that the remote server becomes nnrpd. If the Reader option is given with a value of zero, then this command will not be sent and the connection will be left talking to innd.
trans-unit.target: 读取器-如果远程服务器是INN，则最初将连接到innd，默认情况下， Net::NNTP 将发出 MODE READER 命令，以便远程服务器变为nnrpd。如果 Reader 选项的值为零，则将不发送此命令，并且连接将与innd对话。

trans-unit.source: Reader - If the remote server is INN then initially the connection will be to nnrpd, by default Net::NNTP will issue a MODE READER command so that the remote server becomes innd. If the Reader option is given with a value of zero, then this command will not be sent and the connection will be left talking to nnrpd.
trans-unit.target: 读取器 -如果远程服务器为INN，则最初连接将为nnrpd，默认情况下， Net::NNTP 将发出 MODE READER 命令，以便远程服务器成为innd。如果 Reader 选项的值为零，则将不发送此命令，并且连接将与nnrpd通信。
